P106628.project_name: Consolidation of National Public Management Information Systems

keywords.cdata: accounting, Basic, Borrower, budget execution, budgeting, business model, business processes, Components, conflicts of interest, Currency, Customs, data quality, Disbursement, Disbursements, expenditure, expenditures, Finances, Financial Analysis, Financial Management, Financing Plan, fraud, government entities, ID, Implementation Stage, implementation strategy, implementing agencies, Implementing Agency, Income, Information System, INFORMATION SYSTEMS, information technology, interoperability, Legal Covenants, Lending Instrument, LOAN, Loan Agreement, Loan amount, market research, National Budget, performance measures, Procurement, Project Management, PUBLIC, Public Debt, public expenditure, public expenditure management, result, Results, Risk Management, software solutions, Tax, Technical Assistance, transparency, Treasury

project_abstract.cdata: The development objective of the Consolidation of National Public Management Information Systems Project for Colombia is to improve the transparency, coverage, operation and interoperability of key national financial management information systems that will allow Government decision makers to link performance measures with planning, budgeting and other managerial actions. The restructuring of the project, as described in this restructuring paper, will entail: 1) extension of closing date until December 15, 2014 for a cumulative extension of 23.5 months, 2) redefinition of selected activities for subcomponent 4.2; and 3) partial cancellation of the loan with respect to the original allocation for component three (DIAN). The changes are necessary to the achievement and sustainability of the Project Development Objective (PDO). The PDO continues to be achievable within the proposed extension, and would allow the Ministry of Finance to complete key activities already initiated, identified and agreed upon in the project procurement plan including the proposed activities. The extension will contribute to not only the full achievement of the PDO, but also to the sustainability of the final outcomes achieved under the project.
